numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts a difference between young men and young women.
2. The graph depicts how likely young men and young women are to communicate with their parents daily.
3. Young women are more likely than young men to contact their parents at least once a day.
4. Most daily communication is digital.
5. Just under 75 percent of young women text their parents.
6. Over 50 percent of young women call their parents.
7. About 25 percent of young women visit their parents daily or weekly.
8. Young men are less likely than young women to communicate actively with their parents.
9. About 50 percent of young men text their parents.
10. Between 25 percent and 50 percent of young men call their parents.
11. Less than 25 percent of young men see their parents frequently.
12. I wonder why the percentage of seeing parents regularly is low.
13. The poll asked 18-34-year-olds.
14. These 18-34-year-olds live with one parent or with no parent.
15. I think that the statistic is low.
16. I wonder how these statistics have changed over time.
17. Social media exists.
18. New technology exists.
19. I wonder whether social media and new technology caused a significant increase in daily communication between young people and their parents.
20. This topic relates to my community.
21. I am a teenager.
22. Communication with my parents is important.
23. Communication with most of my friends' parents is important.
24. If we do not answer our parents right away, then parents can become anxious.
25. If we do not check in frequently, then parents can become anxious.
26. I wonder whether the numbers will increase in the upcoming generation.
27. I think that constant communication between a child and a parent is needed.
28. The headline is: Call Your Mom! Young People And Their Lackluster Interest In Talking To Their Parents.
